Package shaharas

Class BaseBinaryOperators

java.lang.Object
shaharas.BaseOperators
shaharas.BaseBinaryOperators
All Implemented Interfaces:
Operators
Direct Known Subclasses:
Add, AddEQL, CloseParen, Div, DivEQL, Equals, Mul, MulEQL, OpenParen, Sub, SubEQL
abstract class BaseBinaryOperators extends BaseOperators
The BaseBinaryOperators class is an abstract class that represents binary operators in the system. A binary operator operates on two operands. This class extends the BaseOperators class and serves as the foundation for specific binary operators like addition, subtraction, multiplication, etc. It contains methods for setting operands, cloning operators, and calculating results based on operator functionality.

  • Constructor Details

    • BaseBinaryOperators

      public BaseBinaryOperators(int a, Pattern compile, String symbol, int priority)
      Constructor to initialize a binary operator with an operand, a regular expression pattern, a symbol, and priority. The operand `a` represents the left-hand side operand, the `compile` is the regular expression pattern to match the operator, the `symbol` is the operator's symbol (e.g., "+", "-", etc.), and `priority` determines the operator's precedence.
      Parameters:
      a - The left operand for the operator.
      compile - A compiled regular expression to match the operator.
      symbol - The symbol representing the operator (e.g., "+" for addition).
      priority - The priority level of the operator, indicating its precedence in an expression.

    • BaseBinaryOperators

      public BaseBinaryOperators(BaseBinaryOperators a)
      Copy constructor to create a new instance of BaseBinaryOperators by copying the state from the provided instance.
      Parameters:
      a - An existing BaseBinaryOperators object to be cloned.

  • Method Details

    • setA

      public Operators setA(int a)
      Sets the left operand for the binary operator. This method invokes the parent class's `setA()` method and returns the current operator instance (`this`) for method chaining.
      Specified by:
      setA in interface Operators
      Overrides:
      setA in class BaseOperators
      Parameters:
      a - The left operand value for the operator.
      Returns:
      The current operator instance (`this`).

    • clone

      public abstract Operators clone()
      An abstract method that must be implemented by subclasses to clone a binary operator. This allows for creating a new instance of the binary operator with the same state as the original.
      Specified by:
      clone in interface Operators
      Specified by:
      clone in class BaseOperators
      Returns:
      A new cloned instance of the operator.

    • calculate

      public abstract int calculate(String variable, int... args)
      An abstract method that must be implemented by subclasses to perform the binary operation. This method defines how the operator will calculate its result based on the operands provided.
      Specified by:
      calculate in interface Operators
      Specified by:
      calculate in class BaseOperators
      Parameters:
      variable - The name of the variable used in the operation (if any).
      args - The arguments to be used in the operation (in this case, the second operand for the binary operator).
      Returns:
      The result of the binary operation.
